page.title: 16THE VILLAGE STORES
page.content: {It}is one of two shops in Tedburn. It is owned and run by the Kibbey family, who live on the premises. {The building}is about 350 years old, and was once a toll house. In the 1920's an extension was added and it became a saddlers. Later,petrol served from the forecourt. It is now a general store, open six days a week. {The services}include groceries, a newsagency, frozen foods, greengrocery, tobacconist, stationery, confectionery, chemist, drinks and fresh foods. {Children}from 13 years old are employed to deliver papers morning and evening. {The Shop}is a distribution point for medical prescriptions. Village events are advertised in the shop, and it is a meeting place for villagers who live in a widely scattered community.
